ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Lots of new grammar and as much vocab as in L1

This course significantly increased my ability to speak and understand Spanish. The professor speaks in Spanish most of the time, and I found myself able to understand what she was saying without thinking about it by the end of the semester.
I learned more vocabulary and grammar in Spanish.
I developed skills in knowledge in the culture and language of spanish and spanish speaking countries.
I learned more Spanish vocabulary and grammar in the course, which I will continue to use in the next level of Spanish.
I learnt how to read, write and speak basic Spanish.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: it forces you to work outside of class and put in extra time. Also really makes you feel like you KNOW the Spanish language Weakness: a lot to process, not enough time to make it all sink in
One strength is that you are forced to emerge yourself in the class. One weakness is that the grading is very arbitrary across professors.
This class is primarily busy work and the class was too big to actually practice speaking.

I believe that more in class speaking would have helped this course and improved my Spanish at a faster pace. That being said, a lot of material is covered in the course, making this difficult time wise. I also think that more cultural lessons could be included in the grammar and vocabulary training. Overall, the course was good, though.

The texts assigned were too advanced for our level. Don Quijote utilized an older form of Spanish, which made it extremely challenging for me to comprehend. One strength of the course is that it meets every day and so students can immerse themselves in the language.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, but be ready to put in the time and effort. It's L1 on super-steroids
I recommend this course if you have to take it for a language requirement, as most students do. Don't take it just for fun; it's a lot of work for that.
I would recommend the course, but wouldn't recommend the professor.
I would recommend the course to improve Spanish language capabilities. If they did not already have an interest in the language, I would not recommend the course.
